title: refactor: Revamp Repo and BlockStore API
body:
Previously, we were handling temporary entries in the blockstore that would prevent GC from clearing new entries and polling a small future that would remove those entries whose timer returned ready when polled. However, as more thought was put more into the previous decision, it was determined that it would be best that the blockstore did not handle this type of logic but instead move it either into the Repo or DataStore where it would be appropriate where GC logic can be added. Furthermore, the blockstores also used a task where we would either get or put blocks into that store, but it probably would be better off using rwlocks or reverting back to the previous methods for more consistency.

This PR:
- Change the internal logics of the blockstore implementation to use locks instead
- Remove temporary map from the blockstore and its api (will be readded later in a datastore update)
- Remove `BlockStore::wipe`
- Remove `BlockStore::cleanup`, update `BlockStore::remove` return to `Result<(), Error>`
- Add `BlockStore::remove_many`
- Change `Repo::cleanup` to be visible to this crate, updating its logic to remove unpinned blocks
- Update `Ipfs::gc` to hold gc lock
- Add `Repo::gc_guard` to prevent gc from running until this guard has dropped.
- Removes deprecated api

title: feat: Implement an internal bitswap protocol
body:
Previously, we used to have a bitswap protocol 1.1.0, however that was succeeded by #66 with the implementation of beetle (previously known as iroh) bitswap protocol. While this protocol does work, the performance may vary as it may not perform to par compared to interactions with kubo. As a result, #125 was implemented to give the option for others to use a different protocol via features while we work on improving these protocols, however it felt that a simpler implementation of bitswap should be implementation to handle the basics of exchanges. 

This PR implements a basic bitswap 1.2.0 protocol allowing one to request a single block by sending a HAVE request for the block to A) a set of peers (or providers of the content), dialing them if they are not connected; or B) all connected peers if a specific set of peers were not supplied. If the node has no connected peers or the peers responded stating they dont have the block, an event is emitted to swarm that attempts to trigger content discovery via DHT.

title: fix: Return correct total_size for Repo::get_total_size
body: Previously, we were checking the size of the metadata of the path directly to determine the total size of the blockstore for flatfs, This was giving improper results when GC runs causing it to attempt to cleanup the blockstore each time it runs, however this was the wrong approach as we should be checking each file itself to measure the size. This change would instead reflect that by checking each file directly and compute the sum of that result.

title: refactor: Removed unixfs free functions
body: This PR changes `UnixfsGet`, UnixfsAdd`, `UnixfsLs` and `UnixfsCat` to take configurable parameters and produce a stream (or future with `IntoFuture` impl) with those configuration rather than having them be parameters apart of the function itself. This makes it cleaner to call the equiv function with default parameters but with the option to supply configuration (like supplying providers or timeout) as needed. Along with this change, we remove the free functions that produce returns one of the items above.

title: feat: Implement experimental support for streams
body: This PR introduce `libp2p-stream`, which provides a way to give access to negotiated streams. At the current time, this will sit behind a feature until a later point in time or when the crate is no longer marked as alpha

title: refactor: Serialize dag internally and minor optimization
chore: Cancel GC task when Ipfs drops
chore: Reduce allocation when initializing Repo
body:
- Move fields to a inner struct for Repo to reduce noticeable allocation during testing
- Change fields in StorageType::Custom to `Option<T>` to allow taking ownership of the items without moving the type
- Perform a lock in gc task instead on specifically on cleanup.

title: refactor: Use `Bytes` apart of unixfs operations
refactor: Use configuration directly instead of using option
chore: Switch from libp2p-nat to libp2p-upnp
feat: Add libp2p-bitswap and feature gate both implementation
body:
This PR implements  libp2p-bitswap-next  (which is a fork libpep-bitswap) as apart of the bitswap implementation to add a simple protocol implementation for exchanging blocks. One change in this PR for this fork includes utilizing existing connections if supplied providers are empty.

Resolves #125 

Note:
- This can be enabled via `libp2p_bitswap` feature. For ipfs compatibility, use `libp2p_bitswap_compat`
- Some features like provider discovery is not supported at this time. This will come later.

title: feat: Implement gc task
body:
This PR implements a garbage collection to allow removing of unpinned blocks. This PR also implements a temporary cache to exclude any newly added blocks for a specific duration (default 2mins) before it is allowed to be cleared by the garbage collector. 

Resolves #17

title: refactor: Simplify peerbook
body:
PeerBook housed several components such as the ability to connect to and disconnect from peers, connection limits, while also storing peer info received from identify. This created a lot of complexity as such components can be outside of the behaviour. 

This PR revises and simplify peerbook behaviour to only deal with peer connections as well as info from identify, which would reduce complexity, while moving connection operations to the main task. This PR also cleans up `IpfsTask`, simplify the listener commands, remove redundant fields, update test, and begin to improve visibility.

title: chore: Deprecate UninitalizedIpfs::{empty, with_opt} for UninitalizedIpfs::new
feat: Implement redb datastore backend
body:
A simple redb datastore backend (based on sled current implementation). 

Note:
- redb operations are in a blocking task rather than on the current task itself to prevent blocking the current thread
- tables are split between data and pin to prevent possible conflicts

title: refactor: Verify protocol in handler
body: resolves #78

title: feat: Implement recursive block removal
body:
This PR allows for recursive removal of blocks - aka removing any linked blocks to its parent/root block. 

Note: This will not remove pinned children blocks.

title: feat: Implement Repo::get_blocks
body:
- Implements `Repo::get_blocks`
- Change event to accept an array of cids

title: chore: Ignore deprecation and dont close connection within handler
body: This PR removes code that would close a connection within the handler due to it being deprecated in rust-libp2p. This PR also ignore deprecation warnings (pending removal in a later update), removes locks in bitswap behaviour and remove disconnection logic.

title: feat: Implement custom futures/streams for unixfs related functions
refactor: Disable primary protocols by default
body:
Currently, behaviours within rust-libp2p are enabled by default, which allows things to function as intended but out of the box, however if one wishes to disable a specific protocol that they may not need or may conflict with a custom implementation, then it would not be possible to do so. 

This PR disables primary protocols by default, while introducing functions in `UninitializedIpfs` to enable them. Each primary behaviour has its own `with_` function, which would allow one to enable the behaviour and possibly use a custom configuration. To enable the default behaviours, one can use `UninitializedIpfs::with_default`, which would enable identify, kad, bitswap, pubsub, autonat, ping,

title: refactor: Move repo logic into a single task
body: Resolves #107

title: feat: Implement timeout when resolving blocks
body:
In the current implementation, we wait an indefinite amount of time for a block to be resolved, which includes asking peers via bitswap, searching over dht for providers, etc., however this is not a desirable behaviour as the node may wish to cancel or abort the event at some point if no block is discovered within a duration. 

This PR implements a timeout in `Repo::get_block_with_session` while it is awaiting on bitswap to perform actions to fetch the block. The `Ipfs` api will only default to 60 seconds while setting a timeout can be done within `IpfsUnixfs`, `IpfsDag` or `Repo`.

title: fix: Emit event on dial failure of a pending connection
chore: Remove deprecated and idling behaviour
body: This remove the connection idle behaviour and keepalive usage within test replacing it with `SwarmBuilder::idle_connection_timeout`

title: fix: Set dns resolver as a field, and fix resolved path
body:
- Add `DnsResolver` as a field to `Ipns`, removing it as an argument for resolving
- Include subpath in the resolved path from ipns

title: chore: Cleanup and improvements
body:
- Return early if protocol is disabled
- Remove redundant spawning

title: feat: Implement rendezvous protocol
body: Resolves #100

title: feat: Implement idle connection timeout
body: Resolves #97

title: feat: Implementation of a relay manager
body:
This PR introduce a relay manager crate at the aim of being a rewrite of `libp2p-autorelay` with the means of simplifying the logic.  

Note:
- This will not utilize any autorelay selection at this time
- Does not check over DHT for any relays (largely due to determining the best course besides emitting an event with a channel)

Reference:
- https://github.com/dariusc93/rust-ipfs/issues/4

title: fix: Dont close connections on ping error
body:
In the current implementation, we would close connections after a max of a single ping error. However, this has less than desirable effects on bitswap and other communications.

This PR will remove the tracking and handling of ping except for storing a successful ping within `PeerBook`

title: chore: Uncomment and update relay configuration
chore: Optimizations and updates
body:
- Removed redundant stream wrapper
- Removed `Ipfs::connection_events` (use custom behaviour for tracking connection events)
- Optimize peerbook when polling
- Update libp2p to 0.52.3
- Added `Repo::migration` to migrate data from one repo to another.

title: refactor: Make `Repo` independent
body:
In the current implementation, `Repo` is initialized and used while initializing `Ipfs`, making it require for repo and dag operations, however there may be instances where such operations should be separate (eg only needing to load blocks locally without initializing `Ipfs` or needing it to be online, etc). 

This PR separates `Repo` out to be independent of `Ipfs` but can still be used within an instance when calling `UninitializedIpfs::set_repo`. Repo can also be used with `IpldDag` without `Ipfs`, and unixfs functions, however online operations will not work unless `Ipfs` is initialized and used.

title: chore: Add `UninitializedIpfs::listen_as_external_addr`
body:
rust-libp2p 0.52 update introduce changes that revolves around the use of external addresses, which provides the address(es) where the node can be reach. Currently, in its default behaviour, any addresses being listened on may always be used or considered as an external address. 

This PR adds `UninitializedIpfs::listen_as_external_addr` to allow using any local and private addresses as external addresses.

title: feat: Basic record key/prefix validator and basic ipns publisher/resolver
body:
In the current implementation, there is no way to properly obtain dht records from the IPFS network, or more specifically IPNS record, as well as implementing a way to validate prefix and possibly records. 

This PR introduce a few things:

1. A basic way of validating the record key when obtaining and  possibly setting the dht record. At this time, the default implementation would attempt to validate ipns prefix and generate a possible `Key` for that that would work across DHT. This does not implement/validate pk record prefix. Custom implementation can eventually validate their own record prefix.
2. rust-ipns, which will be used to create, decode and verify ipns records (WIP)
3. ipns resolver over DHT (WIP)
4. ipns publisher over DHT (WIP)


Related to #1 

Note:
1. Ipns resolver and publisher are behind a experimental feature at this time, but will be removed once consider stabled enough
2. This PR wont fetch the records from the datastore and store it into kad by default at this time, but this will change in the future
3. If used, it is suggested to set datastore manually to use sled, memory, or your own data store implementation

title: refactor: Use quick-protobuf
body:
Currently, we use prost to handle protobuf, however due to changes made in prost, it required that protoc to be installed manually. This PR switches to quick-protobuf, thus removing the external dependency.

Resolves #15

title: feat: Support custom transport
body:
- Implements UninitializedIpfs::set_custom_transport that uses a boxed function signature to allow one to support their own transport
- Implements memory transport (for future internal use)

title: chore: Implement functions to add session to bitswap
body: This implementation would introduce private functions to allow sessions to be assigned to any unixfs operations for it to be used with bitswap.

title: refactor: Use channels instead of Subscription
body:
Previously, we use `Subscription` to handle broadcasting results for a request, however the implementation has been a bit more redundant and possibly error prone. This change will use channels instead that would send the results to the awaiting task.

Note:
- This will begin to remove the subscription system completely in the near future

title: feat: Ability to add custom behaviour
body:
Current implementation does not allow passing of custom behaviours to `Swarm`, which it hard to be flexible and being able to extend functionality further at a lower level. 

In this implementation,  We allow support of a single custom behaviour to be passed with `NetworkBehaviour<OutEvent = void::Void>` type. This will allow one to use `UninitializedIpfs::set_custom_behaviour` to set a behaviour with their own logic to be use along side the behaviours that are apart of this library.

Resolves #30 

Note: 
- Behaviours should not block while it is being polled (may put a timer on how long a behaviour can last before being terminated if it does block)
- May have to use channels to communicate with the behaviour as the current methods will not support sending commands to that behaviour.
- Does not support custom events at this time, but may open up to this idea in the future

title: feat: Implement Ipfs::connection_events
body: This implementation will create a steam that would yield `ConnectionEvent` regarding a given peer.

title: chore: Remove the initial notify
body:
Previously, when `UninitializedIpfs::start` is called, it would wait until swarm is polled the first time before notifying the notifier and returning the function. This would give the chance for `Swarm` to initially process any listeners, bootstraps, if any, etc. However, this would cause a bit of a problem if `Swarm` is being polled but there is nothing returning from the stream. This may be the case when the crate is running behind a VPN, etc. 

This change removes the notifier, while also introducing `Ipfs::listening_addresses` and `Ipfs::external_addresses`. In the event that swarm does not have any addresses, it would await on any responses from swarm before returning.

title: chore: Use channels instead of broadcasting
body:
Previously, we would only emit events from topics that we are subscribed too through a broadcast channel, but this have appear to produce less than desirable results as the event is not always broadcasted, which may be due to the channel "lag". 

With this change, it will instead utilize channels and perform a filter within the change for a given topic before yielding the event to the stream.

title: chore: Prep for libp2p 0.52 update
body:
Along with the update, the changes include:
- Update to libp2p-nat
- Close connection on a ping that was timed out or had an hard error after a number of times 
- Restructure workspace
- Support for custom behaviour events
- Remove deprecated code and cleanup codebase
- Change swarm default configuration

title: refactor: Confirm event from swarm when disconnecting from peer
body:
In the current implementation, we would close the connection from the behaviour and await the event before sending the result to oneshot, however while we get a successful event, the peer still hangs around in the swarm pool for a few milliseconds. This is not a problem, however in events where one would need to check if the peer is disconnected right away from `Swarm::is_connected` or `Swarm::connected_peers`, this may not be favorable unless there is a delay prior to returning the disconnect function. 

Note: This may change in the future to just have `Ipfs::is_connected` rely on any peers in `PeerBook` rather than check against `Swarm`, but checking against swarm does confirm if we are still connected to the peer or not.

title: feat: Implement Keystore
body: Resolves #65

title: feat: Implements MultiaddrExt and remove wrapper
body:
Previously, we used wrappers (MultiaddrWith[Out]PeerId) for handling multiaddr with and without peer id, however that wrapper was a bit more redundant moving forward. This implementation introduces a extension trait that gives a little bit more functionality around multiaddr while also removing the wrappers and using `Multiaddr` in its place. 

Resolves #26 
Resolves #11

title: feat: Basic AddressBook implementation
body:
In the current implementation, there is nowhere to store address(es) of peers. `PeerBook` will store the addresses of peers who connect, but that is only during the time they are connected. After they disconnect, their addresses will be removed. 

This implementation will allow adding and removing peers and their addresses. When a peer connects, it will automatically add their address into the behaviour if the configuration option to allow it is set to true (by default it is enabled).

title: feat: Add event stream for pubsub subscribing and unsubscribing events
body: This is a small implementation that would broadcast subscribing and unsubscribing events when to a topic the node is subscribed too.

title: feat: Implement RepoProvider
body:
Current implementation does not give the option to automatically provide any provider records over DHT to allow for content to be discoverable by other peers. This implementation will introduce RepoProvider to allow one to provide either all of their blocks, pinned blocks, or root blocks (TBD) at the start of the node. 

Note: 
- At this time, this does not provide unixfs root blocks (will come later)
- This will automatically append to the amount of blocks to the store configure so there is enough space to cover all possible blocks.
- This will not filter out blocks to determine which ones are unixfs and which ones are just DAG objects, which would cause DAG blocks to be provided over DHT

title: fix: Return events from gossipsub stream
body: Previously, we would checking to see if the peer is actually subscribed and adding or removing them without returning the event, which made it impossible to track subscribing and unsubscribing events from the swarm. This will remove those checks, which may have been redundant, and return the event while polling the behaviour.

title: refactor: Switch bitswap implementation
body:
Previously, we were using a bitswap implementation that was based on 1.1.0, however the functionality of such implementation was mostly generic and did not have a lot of management towards peers, queries, etc. In this implementation, we switch out our current implementation with a fork of beetle bitswap protocol (previously known as iroh, see https://github.com/n0-computer/beetle), which will be under the name `beetle-bitswap-next`, to handle and manage bitswap sessions. Although a lot more needs to be done, it performs pretty well (with some hit or miss with exchanging of blocks), and would likely allow expanding functionality in the future. 

Along with this change:
- Provide a block through RepoEvent::NewBlock
- Add peer to bitswap through `Ipfs::add_peer` (note: this will likely change in the future)
- Implement sessions when requesting new block

Resolves #12 

[Simple] Changelog for beetle-bitswap-next:
- Remove unnecessary crates
- Update libp2p to 0.51[.3]
- Remove entry from `PeerLedger::cancel_want` if set is empty to reduce allocations
- Call `PeerLedger::cancel_want` if we dont have a block for peer

Notes:
- For rust-ipfs <-> kubo, exchanging of blocks are pretty fast, usually less than a minute on average with a 1GB file (randomly generated data), exchanged over local connection
- For rust-ipfs <-> rust-ipfs, exchanging of blocks can take over a couple of minutes on average with a 1GB file, exchanged over local connection
- There are times where exchanging may stop briefly, mainly while bootstrapped over dht, which looks to last for about a minute at times before resuming. This happens more with crate to crate communication than communicating with kubo, however it has happened with kubo before too.
- There was a high memory usage due to `PeerLedger` storing a map of cids with a list of peers, however this was changed so if we dont have the block, we would remove the peer from the list, and remove the entry if the list is empty, however we would need to look to make sure this doesnt have any effects on other functionalities either
- We may need to create a local session manager for `unixfs` functions so we can pass through and track sessions `IpfsUnixfs` functions, so we can reuse the same peers under the session than staying with a single session or incrementing the session id per new requested block.

title: fix: Remove item from want list
body: Current implementation does not do anything with the received want list if it receives a want but the node does not contain the block it requested, causing the list to build up over time, resulting in high memory usage. This small fix will use a channel to communicate to the behaviour if the repo does not contain the block so that it would remove the block from any ledger that may want said block

title: chore: Impl sled datastore, split stores into own modules
body:
- Basic implementation for sled datastore
- Split stores into their own modules.

title: chore: Configuration and behaviour cleanup
body:
- Add KadStoreInserts into configuration
- Change IdentifyConfiguration default values
- Move `Ipfs::insert_pin` logic to `Repo::insert_pin`

title: chore: Reduce allocations
body:
- Reduce number of channels for broadcast
- Added `Repo::put_block_with_cancellation` that is used only by receiving a block from bitswap to cancel the request. This will prevent storing cancel request in the ledger when adding your own blocks via `Ipfs::put_dag`, `Ipfs::put_block`, or its underlining functions. Note this function is not publicly accessible and only used internally, which may change in the future when bitswap implementation change.

title: chore: Store rtt without checking on peer info
feat: Adds IpfsUnixfs
body:
- Add IpfsUnixfs
- Adds IpfsUnixfs::ls and unixfs::ls for listing unixfs directory contents

Note:
- This Will begin to migrate away from using the owned unixfs functions (likely to be pushed behind a feature). This implementation will also not factor or include MFS (which will likely be implemented at a later point in the future once the datastore is stored out)

title: refactor: Remove `Column` from DataStore
body: There wasnt a lot of information on the need for the `Column` enum for the data store so in this case, it would be best to remove it before implementation of the datastore for fs

title: chore(repo): Added field to only check locally
body: Added a field to `Repo` to further locally for the blocks rather than on the network, with default functionality supporting the latter.

title: refactor: Remove KeyPair from IpfsOptions
body:
- Removes Keypair from IpfsOptions
- Remove DebuggableKeypair due to `Keypair` supporting Debug
- Adds `Ipfs::keypair` to allow access to the keypair to the node. Note this will get replace with a keystore in the future, which may be in-memory or on disk.

title: refactor: Provide peers when obtaining blocks
body:
This implementation would allow a set of peers to be supplied to functions to bypass the need of attempting to find providers over DHT, especially in situations where DHT may be disabled but one would be connected to peers that may contain blocks. 

Note:
- If none of the supplied peers have the block(s) requested, this would not fallback to using DHT automatically. This may change when bitswap is updated (see #12)
- If no set of peers are supplied and DHT is enabled, it would instead attempt to find providers over DHT (which may change to target specific peers instead of all connected peers)
- Peers would need to be connected prior to any exchanges of blocks.

title: chore: Make mplex optional
body:
- Make Mplex optional
- Default to Yamux

title: refactor: Remove SwarmApi
body:
This will begin to remove the `SwarmApi` behaviour.

Closes #13

title: chore: Wait on identify before returning connection
body: Before `PeerBook` behaviour would return once a connection is establish, but at times this may create a race as we may be awaiting for identify to send the info of the peer before attempting to do anything else (eg connecting to a relay before attempting to listen on the circuit). This change would wait on `Info` to be injected before sending to the oneshot channel. After 5 seconds (which may get adjusted or customized in the future), it would send to the channel regardless of if `Identify` sent the info or not.

title: feat(repo): Allow custom repo store
body:
- Add `Ipfs::repo` to expose `Repo`
- Allow custom implementation of block and data store (Note that there will be refactoring to the traits to allow easier implementations

title: chore: Make kademlia optional
body: Kademlia protocol will be enabled by default, but can be disabled by setting `IpfsOptions::disable_kad` to true or using `UninitializedIpfs::disable_kad`

title: chore: Cleanup deprecation
body: Cleanup any deprecation

title: fix: Change condition when attempting to clear out cache
body: Peer list was not being cleared out due to using the wrong condition.

title: chore: Add KadConfig
body:
- Added KadConfig to be used apart of `IpfsOptions` 
- Use `Either` to allow using the internal config or libp2p config of Kad

title: refactor: Changes to connection and listening functions
body:
- Use `Either` for the oneshot channel to yield different values
- Use PeerBook for dialing 
  - Note: Originally this would be done by waiting for the swarm events, but may not give an outgoing error, so using a `NetworkBehaviour` in this case would allow us to get a proper response
 - Remove unused functions and begun to strip down `SwarmAPI`

title: refactor: Use broadcast for pubsub stream
body: Use broadcast to allow multiple pubsub stream of the same topic.

title: chore: Minor Config for Pubsub
body: Implemented small config for pubsub

title: chore: Cleanup of unixfs functions
body: Minor cleanup to unixfs functions

title: refactor/repo: Remove IpfsTypes
body: This will be a refactor to remove IpfsTypes and RepoTypes.

title: feat: basic PeerBook implementation.
body:
This behaviour will handle storing peer identify info, rtt, as well as a whitelist for the connection limits implementation, which would allow a peer who is whitelisted to bypass such limits and be able to establish a connection.  

This implementation will also begin to split apart `SwarmAPI` to eventually begin the process of deprecating or refactoring it in the future.

title: refactor: Custom DNS and misc to TransportConfig
body: Refactors TransportConfig to allow for for custom dns (and not be specific to just cloud flare), remove YamuxConfig and MplexConfig and added fields to map value to those corresponding functions.

title: chore: Update to libp2p 0.51
body:
- Reduce and remove deprecated functions
- Re-enables quic-v1 due to conflict from when 0.51 was published 
- Use default configuration for Relay v2 due to specific modules being private
- Fix test

Question:
- Do we really need to use `reservation_rate_limiters` and `circuit_src_rate_limiters` for the relay server configuration? So far I have not found any code or test using these fields in any way so this may get removed from our side to leave those fields in the config being default.

title: chore/: Add small delay before processing events
body: There seems to be a lot of cpu usage when running the events in a loop that is not experienced before (although this was experience prior to changing from using a Future to a tokio task but became more noticeable after). Not exactly a desirable change though but does work without compromising the loop itself until this is looked into more or a more suitable change is implemented.

title: refactor/subscription: Use channels instead of subscription
body:
rust-ipfs have been using `Subscription` for awhile, and although its purpose has been more of a registry for request, I have found it to be no longer necessary for majority of request as using a oneshot channel and a hashmap could get the same results needed. This PR will begin the process to remove or reduce the usage of Subscription in exchange for futures oneshot channels.

Note:
- This does not remove it completely right now, but the majority will be removed
- Tests still run without any changes to them
- Some task may require its own hashmap field (which would be better for separate task)
